facts: The scene is set in the kitchen of Charlie Kaufman's house, at day light.
Donald has their mum paying for the seminar.
Donald pitches his screenplay to their mum.
Donald's mon described his screenplay as "Silence of the Lambs" meets "Psycho."

Kaufman sits at a card table, picking at a salad and reading
an orchid book.
Donald lies on the floor, chomping a hoagie and reading a copy of Story by Robert McKee.
Kaufman is reading out loud from the book, but soon will become bored of it, Donald is eating while ignoring him.
comm_style: Charlie embodies the stereotype of the neurotic writer
Charlie is depicted as a lovelorn, depressed screenwriter who grapples with feelings of professional inadequacy and personal isolation.
Donald Kaufman is Charlie's twin brother
goals: Kaufman stops reading and starts a conversation with Donald
Donald tells Kaufman about the the positive things about the seminar and the feedback on the screenplay
